title: Album Page, "Recto: Rubbing of Inscription from Statue of Colleoni, Venice, Italy; Verso: Inscriptions on Front and Back of Colleoni Monument, Venice, Italy", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper, folded and tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, clockwise from upper left center:to show finial; L larger than the / other letters be. . . / in width; Inscription Coleoni [sic] Statue / Venise [sic].  Verso, in graphite: left column: Front / Bartholomeo / Coleono / Bergomensi / Cebbididare (?) / Imperium / Optime / Gestrum (?) / S. C..  Right column: back / Ioane = Mauro / ct + Marino / Venezio / Curatoribus / ann + sol / MCCCC L XXXXV. Upper right corner: 124; lower right corner: 117; bottom right of sheet: Inscription Coleoni [sic] statue / Venice.
dimensions: Sheet: 30.6 x 41.6 cm (12 1/16 x 16 3/8 in.), irregular
description: Horizontal sheet folded in half and tipped vertically into binding depicting two rows of letters that have been rubbed from a carved stone surface.  Top row: M C C (bottom curve and terminal only) L X; bottom row: N I.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Recto: Rubbing of Inscription from Statue of Colleoni, Venice, Italy; Verso: Inscriptions on Front and Back of Colleoni Monument, Venice, Italy", late 19th century.Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper, folded and tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-293.
